intro: Neea glomeruliflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved clustered-flowered neea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often as an understory species. Its leaves are broad and glossy, and it produces small, white or pinkish flowers in dense clusters. This variant is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to the typical form of N. glomeruliflora.
